critique: This document pertains to the process by which the Personnel Classification Board can review and change the allocation of a position. It includes provisions for consultation with department heads and opportunities for incumbents to be heard. It also allows for the continuation of pay for incumbents if a position is changed to a lower grade. The document outlines a process for checks and balances, including a role for the President in resolving disputes. It does not directly address ideological issues, immigration, or civil liberties. It has a slight impact on federalism and executive power. It also has a slight impact on economic regulation.
